intro: Cynoglossum dioscoridis var. maroccanum, commonly known as Moroccan mouse-ear, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Morocco. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
